metadata.title: CVE-2018-8005 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When there are multiple ranges in a range request, Apache Traffic Server(ATS) will read the entire object from cache. This can cause performanceproblems with large objects in cache. This affects versions 6.0.0 to 6.2.2and 7.0.0 to 7.1.3. To resolve this issue users running 6.x users shouldupgrade to 6.2.3 or later versions and 7.x users should upgrade to 7.1.4 orlater versions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8005` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 7.1.4+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 7.1.4+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.1.4+ds-1').
